column1: Indicators
Population not accessing the internet

Urban population lacking convenient access to public
transport
Adult population (aged 15+ years) who are illiterate

Young adult population (aged 21-23 years) with
incomplete upper secondary education
Population lacking access to electricity

Population lacking access to clean fuels and
technologies for cooking, heating and lighting

Population-weighted score on the Gender Inequality
Index (global gap between women and men in terms of
reproductive health, empowerment and employment)
Population with moderate to severe food insecurity
Population undernourished

Population living in countries without high coverage
ofessential health services (Universal Health
Coverage Index score less than 60 out of 100)

Population living in countries with under-5
mortality rate exceeding 25 per 1,000 live births
Urban population living in slums or informal settlements

Population living below the societal poverty line,
set at half their country's median household
income or at least $15 a day

Population of young people (aged 15-24 years) not
in employment, education or training

Population stating that they perceive
widespread corruption in government and business

Population living in countries with a homicide rate
of 5 or more per 100,000
Population living in countries governed by an autocratic regime

Population living in countries with a Palma ratio of 2 or more
(the income share of the richest 10% of people relative
to the poorest 40%)

Population stating that they are without someone to
count on in times of trouble
Population lacking access to safely managed drinking water
Population lacking access to safely managed sanitation
